Outcome or subgroup title: 3.1 Change in vertigo Show forest plot
subgroup_name: Change in vertigo Show forest plot

No. of studies: The median number of vertigo attacks per month at 2 months follow‐up was 4.5, with a range from 0 to 10.
No. of participants: The median number of vertigo attacks per month at 2 months follow‐up was 5, with a range from 0 to 30.
Statistical method: The authors do not report any statistical analysis of these data. It is not clear whether this is because no analysis was conducted, or because the findings were not significant.

No. of studies: The median number of vertigo attacks per month at 4 months follow‐up was 1.5, with a range from 0 to 10.
No. of participants: The median number of vertigo attacks per month at 4 months follow‐up was 4.5, with a range from 0 to 30.
Statistical method: The authors do not report any statistical analysis of these data. It is not clear whether this is because no analysis was conducted, or because the findings were not significant.

No. of studies: The median DHI score at 2 months follow‐up was 33, with a range from 16 to 80.

No. of studies: The median DHI score at 4 months follow‐up was 20, with a range from 0 to 86.
No. of participants: The median DHI score at 4 months follow‐up was 33, with a range from 8 to 64.
Statistical method: The authors do not report any statistical analysis of these data. It is not clear whether this is because no analysis was conducted, or because the findings were not significant.

No. of studies: The median number of headache attacks per month at 2 months follow‐up was 5, with a range from 0 to 10.
No. of participants: The median number of headache attacks per month at 2 months follow‐up was 2.5, with a range from 0 to 10.
Statistical method: The authors report that the P value for comparison of these groups was 0.483.

No. of studies: The median number of headache attacks per month at 4 months follow‐up was 1, with a range from 0 to 5.
No. of participants: The median number of headache attacks per month at 4 months follow‐up was 0.5, with a range from 0 to 6.
Statistical method: The authors report that the P value for comparison of these groups was 0.917.
